intro: Citrus × aurantium f. deliciosa, commonly known as the sweet orange. It is a hybrid citrus plant characterized by its thick, segmented, orange-colored fruit, which is rich in vitamin C and essential oils. The plant typically grows as a small evergreen tree or shrub, with dark green, glossy leaves and fragrant white flowers. Its fruit develops from the flower and is harvested when fully mature, usually in the fall. The plant is widely cultivated for both its fruit and its use in aromatherapy and perfumery.
